Jesse Sparhawk.title: Live at The Box Burlington VT 6/19/06
Jesse Sparhawk.about: This is one of very few solo live show recordings of this string of my performances of which I am aware. It was a great time playing solo performances during this period on bills with James Blackshaw, Glenn Jones (who were both on this bill), Sharron Kraus, Harris Newman, Jack Rose, as well as the bands Espers, Feathers, and Brightblack Morning Light (with Mariee Sioux in tow). Same olde material, nowhere near perfection, but better performances than I remember being captured.
Jesse Sparhawk.credits:
released January 15, 2021
All songs written and performed by Jesse Sparhawk on Acoustic Guitar
Recorded by Greg Davis at The Box, Burlington, VT June 19, 2006
Cover Photo by Jay Eisenberg

Jesse Sparhawk.title: Long/Gone Live
Jesse Sparhawk.about:
Jesse Sparhawk performs on Lever Harp, Lap Steel Guitar, effects.
Composed/Improvised soundtrack to visual artist Erik Ruin's 'Long/Gone,' a 100 ft long hand-cut paper semi-narrative scroll, presented via overhead projector.
Recorded at Delaware Valley Arts Alliance, Narrowsburg, NY 2/29/20.
ALL PROCEEDS FROM THE SALE OF THIS RECORDING WILL BE DONATED TO BLACK LIVES MATTER IN PERPETUITY.

trackinfo.title: Frio de la Aurora (Super Deluxe)
trackinfo.lyrics: Llevo el frío de la aurora en mi no me deja descansar Translation: I have the cold of dawn on me.  It doesn't let me rest.

trackinfo.title: Blancos Pajaros (We Whirled)
trackinfo.lyrics: Gira la tierra en tu mano Blancos pájaros están mirando Cubre la flor de palabras Ven y siéntate al lado del alba Cose el cielo en tu plato Déjalo No lo busques tanto, déjalo No lo apures tanto, déjalo No lo vistas tanto, déjalo Esta ahí, ¿lo puedes ver? ¿Lo puedes ver?, ya va a partir No lo podrás nunca atrapar Esta ahí, ¿lo puedes ver? Maneja la tierra que gira Blancos pájaros vuelan y miran Sirve el cielo cosido Mézclalo con hierro fundido Translation: Turn the earth in your hand White birds are watching Cover the flower with words Come and sit beside the dawn Sew the sky on your plate. Leave it Don't look for it so much, leave it Don't rush it so much, leave it Don't dress it so much, leave it. Don't move it away so much, leave it There it is, can you see? Can you see? It's going to depart You'll never going to catch it There it is, can you see? Handle the earth that turns White birds are flying and watching Serve the sewed sky Mix it with cast iron
trackinfo.credits:
from Montero de Halcones, released December 5, 2013
Produced by Peterson Goodwyn, Alberto Montero, & Jesse Sparhawk.
Mixed by Peterson Goodwyn @ Su Su Studio, Philadelphia, PA
Mastered by D James Goodwin @ The Isokon, Woodstock, NY
All vocals, lyrics, & vocal arrangements written, performed, & recorded by Alberto @ La Logia, Barcelona.
All guitars, electric bass & organ written & performed by Jesse.
All electric bass & organ recorded by Peterson @ Su Su Studio.
All drums performed by Peterson.
Guitar & Drums for Blancos Pájaros (We Whirled) recorded @ Rigby Mansion, Philadelphia, PA by Peterson. Violin & viola written & arranged by Gretchen Lohse, Peterson & Jesse, performed by Gretchen, recorded by Peterson @ Su Su Studio.

trackinfo.title: Duerme La Ciudad (Nadir Nigh)
trackinfo.lyrics: Duerme la ciudad No es necesario esperar Signo, señal Pronto verás Lo que te trato de insinuar No hay nada que decir La noche habla por fin Sin dudar Se entenderá Lo que tu tratas de disimular Duerme la ciudad No hay que esperar Duerme la ciudad Nada que explicar Duerme la ciudad Translation: City Sleeps No need to wait Sign, sign Soon you will see What I try to insinuate Nothing to say The night finally speaks No doubt The term What you try to hide City Sleeps Do not expect City Sleeps Nothing to explain City Sleeps
trackinfo.credits:

trackinfo.title: Recuerdos (Hummingbird)
trackinfo.lyrics: Las hojas crujen desde ayer Un funeral en mi interior Los pájaros quieren volver Pero no encuentran el calor Voy buscando lo que no hay Cosas que quedaron atrás Voy buscando donde no hay Más que grises recuerdos Las hojas crujen desde ayer Un funeral en el calor Los pájaros quieren volver Pero no encuentran mi interior Voy buscando lo que no hay Cosas que quedaron atrás Voy buscando donde no hay Más que grises recuerdos Recuerdos (x4) Voy buscando lo que no hay Cosas que quedaron atrás Voy buscando donde no hay Más que grises recuerdos Recuerdos (x3) Translation: The leaves crunch since yesterday  A funeral inside me  Birds want to return  But there is heat  I'm looking for so no  Things left behind  I'm looking for where there is no  More than gray memories  The leaves crunch since yesterday  A funeral in the heat  Birds want to return  But find my inner  I'm looking for so no  Things left behind  I'm looking for where there is no  More than gray memories  Memories (x4)  I'm looking for so no  Things left behind  I'm looking for where there is no  More than gray memories  Memories (x3)
trackinfo.credits:

trackinfo.title: Lo Puedes Dejar Pasar (When In the Heights)
trackinfo.lyrics: Manchan las alfombras Llueve ahí afuera Suenan las sirenas muy lejos Lo mantengo afuera (x3) Afuera Ladran las persianas Llueve ahí afuera Ríen las botellas muy cerca Lo mantengo afuera (x3) Afuera Lo puedes dejar pasar Translation: Staining the carpets It's raining out there Ringing the sirens far away I keep it outside (x3) Outside Barking the blinds It's raining out there Laughing the bottles so close I keep it outside (x3) Outside You can let it in

trackinfo.title: La Mitad (Oliver's Castle)
trackinfo.lyrics: La mitad  En mitad de Este sueño Te he llegado a conocer Te he llegado a entender En mitad de Tu silencio Te he llegado a comprender La mitad (x4) Mitad de la mitad El medio, el centro La anatomía del conocimiento Translation: In the middle Of this dream I reach to know you I reach to understand you  In the middle  Of your silence I reach to get you The half (x4) Half of the middle, The middle, the center, The anatomy of the knowledge

Jesse Sparhawk.title: or Kestrel Expanded
Jesse Sparhawk.about:
2018 Expanded Edition, self-indulgence be damned, we're unloading the archives! Every version of every track worth hearing, finally combining the tracks from Palmaria Palmata, or Kestrel, Raptor Attention, the Hummingbird single, alternate takes, and something never released all in one convenient location.
Still included free with download: 'or Kestrel Explained,' a 22 page pdf tablature booklet of some of the tunes on the album.
Jesse Sparhawk.credits:
released December 14, 2018
All songs written and performed by Jesse Sparhawk
on Acoustic Guitar, Electric Guitar, and Banjitar
Upright Bass on 5 performed by Tony Leva
Drums on 11, 18, 25, and 28 performed by Raky Sastri
Some recorded by Greg Weeks @
Hexham Head, Philadelphia, PA
Some recorded by Alan Ford @
Kampo Cultural Center, New York, NY
Some recorded by Peterson Goodwyn at Rigby Mansion
& Susustudio Philadelphia, PA
Mixed by Eric Carbonara @
Nada Sound Studios, Upper Darby, PA
Mastered by Carl Saff
Front Cover painting by Jay Eisenberg
photographed by Derek Moench
Deeply indebted to my folks and family,
Eric, Alan, Greg, Walter, Derek, Helena,
Fern Knight, Timesbold, and Philadelphia family,
and everyone and everything else ever, forever

Jesse Sparhawk.title: Prism
Jesse Sparhawk.about: This piece is part of an ambitious multimedia / graphic novel / audio project, all chapters of which were based on the book, "SUM: Forty Tales from the Afterlives" by David Eagleman. Not entirely sure if the full project was, or will ever be released, but here is my chapter contribution entitled, "Prism."

Jesse Sparhawk.title: Sixty Strings
Jesse Sparhawk.label: VHF
Jesse Sparhawk.about: Sixty Strings is an album of two epic duets by Eric Carbonara (22-string upright Chaturangui guitar) and Jesse Sparhawk (38 string lever harp). While Eric has studied Chaturangui extensively with Pandit Debashish Bhattacharya in Kolkata, and Jesse was classically trained by major figures of the harp world in his formative years, the music here is their own - not a mashup of quasi-orientalism and conservatory bloodlessness. Both side-long tracks lay out a spacious framework, with the two players working to support simple but elegant melodies that recall "Brüder des Schattens"-era Popol Vuh and various modal/devotional styles. While the sound of the Chaturangui's sympathetic strings provides a constant electric blanket of comfort, Eric's playing is concise and restrained, forgoing the kind of melismatic ornamentation that is a stylistic tic of much Indian-inspired music. Jesse, whose expert playing adds so much to Fern Knight's complex orchestrations, steps out and extends his instrument using various techniques - fingerpicking guitar-like patterns that interlock with Eric, and using sharply-struck attacks at the upper register for a piano-like effect. On "The Entwined Twin," the dry crack of a snare drum (played by Julius Masri) enters after a few minutes, ratcheting up the urgency and adding an unexpected texture to the proceedings. The excellent recording captures both instruments in detail, with a strong aura of closeup, intimate feel.
Jesse Sparhawk.credits:
released February 16, 2017
Jesse Sparhawk plays Lever Harp
Eric Carbonara plays Upright Chaturangui
Julius Masri plays Snare Drum on The Entwined Twin
Recorded at The Isokon by Eric Carbonara
Mixed at Nada Sound Studios by Eric Carbonara
Mastered by Carl Saff
Photography by Noah Levey
Design by Stephen Schneider
All music written and performed by Jesse Sparhawk and Eric Carbonara (ASCAP, Nada Sound Studio, @ 2011)
Thank you to Daniel James Goodwin, Eli Walker, Bill Kellum, Carrie Levy, Noah Levey, and our families and friends.

Jesse Sparhawk.title: Tributes & Diatribes
Jesse Sparhawk.label: VHF
Jesse Sparhawk.about: Lovely second set of tracks from the entirely unusual duo of Jesse Sparhawk (38 string lever harp) and Eric Carbonara (22 string upright Chaturangui guitar, banjo, nylon string guitar). The four tracks here are restrained and unhurried, letting the elegant string flow breathe and build over each cut. Like on their debut Sixty Strings (vhf#129), there's tons of virtuoso playing, but it's not showy and crass. The guys are more mood builders (deep, cosmic, meditative) than doodlers. What's best about this is that even tho' it's immediately graspable by those of us who like "our kind" of music, it really doesn't sound like anyone else - a rare achievement. Along with the main dialog between the two players, the arrangements are filled out with percussion by Peterson Goodwyn, giving some of the tracks an overt groove that cuts against the spiraling string notes. Beautiful.
Jesse Sparhawk.credits:
released February 16, 2017
Eric Carbonara: Upright Chaturangui, 6 String Banjo, Nylon String Guitar
Jesse Sparhawk: Lever Harp
Peterson Goodwyn: Janggu, Drum Kit
All compositions written and performed by Jesse Sparhawk and Eric Carbonara.
Recorded by Eric Carbonara and Peterson Goodwyn at Nada Sound Studio in Upper Darby, PA
Mastered by Carl Saff at Saff Mastering in Chicago, IL
